thread.title: Seven local teams set to play in MLK Classic on Monday
thread.title_full: Seven local teams set to play in MLK Classic on Monday

author: The Daily News Sports Staff sports@tdn.com
title: Seven local teams set to play in MLK Classic on Monday
text:
Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save Lower Columbia College Athletics will host the Diamond Showcase MLK Classic high school boys and girls basketball event on Martin Luther King Jr. Day , Monday. There will be eight games in total which will all be played at LCC’s Myklebust Gymnasium.
Quality journalism doesn't happen without your help Support local news coverage and the people who report it by subscribing to The Daily News.
Six Cowlitz County teams and Wahkiakum are set to play in the showcase. The Kalama girls will get things started against Battleground (4A) at 9:30 a.m. The Castle Rock boys will then face off against Toledo (2B) at 11 a.m., followed by Kelso and Hockinson (2A) girls at 12:30 p.m.
Next up we have two local teams battling it out when the Wahkiakum (1B) and Kalama (1A) boys battle it out at 2 p.m. The Mark Morris boys will look to take down another 3A opponent when they duel Evergreen at 6:30 p.m. Finally, the Kelso boys will play W.F. West (2A) in the final game of the day at 8 p.m.
People are also reading… Longview's new credit card fee goes into effect Longview man arrested in 1983 Iowa homicide cold case Hotel at Cowlitz County Event Center fell through in 2023. Here is where plans stand now. Longview restaurant to host sports simulator, from golf to baseball Cowlitz County Sheriff's Office searches for missing woman Longview staff to use ATVs, so council OKs vehicles for everyone 2025 season might be last for Cowlitz Black Bears in Longview Highlands shooter tells police he was protecting sister RA Long coach searches for possible 99th win at Civil War game Longview city manager finalists include parks and rec leader, St. Helens employee, more Police: Kelso man tries to light butane canister in home during arrest State and gun shop clash at WA Supreme Court over high-capacity magazine ban Family of 3 loses pet in Coal Creek fire Longview police: More arrests possible after Highlands shooting Local industrial boom drives concrete materials company's move to Kalama Tickets prices are $10 for adults and $7 for seniors and children for all-day entry. All proceeds will go to support LCC women’s basketball.
Stay up to date on Lower Columbia news, wherever you go Check out more coverage at x.com/DRosenfieldTDN .
